title: Ticket #2000: condor init script fails when UID is read-only variable
description:
Jens Voeckler reported that the condor init script installed by the condor rpm does not work under CentOS 5.5. He sees the following output: 

gawk: warning: escape sequence `\.' treated as plain `.'
gawk: warning: escape sequence `\.' treated as plain `.'
CondorUID=3D101
/etc/init.d/condor: line 429: UID: readonly variable
check_ins: 2011-Mar-24 15:35   Check-in [21139]: Fix for condor init script when UID is a read-only shell variable. #2000 (By Dan Bradley )
creator: danb
